channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Adaptive Value Decomposition with Greedy Marginal Contribution Computation for Cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We first illustrate that the proposed value decomposition can consider the complicated interactions among agents and is feasible to learn in large-scale scenarios.

item.title: Heterogeneous Anomaly Detection for Software Systems via Semi-supervised Cross-modal Attention
item.description: Our study demonstrates that logs and metrics can manifest system anomalies collaboratively and complementarily, and neither of them only is sufficient.

item.title: simpleKT: A Simple But Tough-to-Beat Baseline for Knowledge Tracing
item.description: Knowledge tracing (KT) is the problem of predicting students' future performance based on their historical interactions with intelligent tutoring systems.

item.title: DiffFashion: Reference-based Fashion Design with Structure-aware Transfer by Diffusion Models
item.description: We focus on a new fashion design task, where we aim to transfer a reference appearance image onto a clothing image while preserving the structure of the clothing image.

item.title: Team-DETR: Guide Queries as a Professional Team in Detection Transformers
item.description: Recent proposed DETR variants have made tremendous progress in various scenarios due to their streamlined processes and remarkable performance.

item.title: Conservative State Value Estimation for Offline Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose Conservative State Value Estimation (CSVE), a new approach that learns conservative V-function via directly imposing penalty on OOD states.

item.title: Universal Guidance for Diffusion Models
item.description: Typical diffusion models are trained to accept a particular form of conditioning, most commonly text, and cannot be conditioned on other modalities without retraining.

item.title: Lero: A Learning-to-Rank Query Optimizer
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a learning to rank query optimizer, called Lero, which builds on top of the native query optimizer and continuously learns to improve query optimization.

item.title: UKnow: A Unified Knowledge Protocol for Common-Sense Reasoning and Vision-Language Pre-training
item.description: This work presents a unified knowledge protocol, called UKnow, which facilitates knowledge-based studies from the perspective of data.

item.title: Hard-aware Instance Adaptive Self-training for Unsupervised Cross-domain Semantic Segmentation
item.description: The divergence between labeled training data and unlabeled testing data is a significant challenge for recent deep learning models.

item.title: Optimal Transport for Change Detection on LiDAR Point Clouds
item.description: However, the DEM's interpolation step causes an information loss related to the height of the objects, affecting the detection capability of building changes, where the high resolution of LiDAR point clouds in the third dimension would be the most beneficial.

item.title: SwitchPrompt: Learning Domain-Specific Gated Soft Prompts for Classification in Low-Resource Domains
item.description: Prompting pre-trained language models leads to promising results across natural language processing tasks but is less effective when applied in low-resource domains, due to the domain gap between the pre-training data and the downstream task.

item.title: YOWOv2: A Stronger yet Efficient Multi-level Detection Framework for Real-time Spatio-temporal Action Detection
item.description: Designing a real-time framework for the spatio-temporal action detection task is still a challenge.

item.title: SCONNA: A Stochastic Computing Based Optical Accelerator for Ultra-Fast, Energy-Efficient Inference of Integer-Quantized CNNs
item.description: To leverage the innate precision flexibility of stochastic computing, we invent an MRR-based optical stochastic multiplier (OSM).

item.title: Exploiting Summarization Data to Help Text Simplification
item.description: One of the major problems with text simplification is the lack of high-quality data.

item.title: Practical Cross-system Shilling Attacks with Limited Access to Data
item.description: With the idea of Cross-system Attack, we design a Practical Cross-system Shilling Attack (PC-Attack) framework that requires little information about the victim RS model and the target RS data for conducting attacks.

item.title: Modeling Complex Event Scenarios via Simple Entity-focused Questions
item.description: Event scenarios are often complex and involve multiple event sequences connected through different entity participants.

item.title: Energy Transformer
item.description: Transformers have become the de facto models of choice in machine learning, typically leading to impressive performance on many applications.

item.title: EspalomaCharge: Machine learning-enabled ultra-fast partial charge assignment
item.description: Our hybrid approach couples a graph neural network to a streamlined charge equilibration approach in order to predict molecule-specific atomic electronegativity and hardness parameters, followed by analytical determination of optimal charge-equilibrated parameters that preserves total molecular charge.

item.title: Lightsolver challenges a leading deep learning solver for Max-2-SAT problems
item.description: Maximum 2-satisfiability (MAX-2-SAT) is a type of combinatorial decision problem that is known to be NP-hard.

item.title: Investigating Multi-source Active Learning for Natural Language Inference
item.description: We show that four popular active learning schemes fail to outperform random selection when applied to unlabelled pools comprised of multiple data sources on the task of natural language inference.

item.title: A modern look at the relationship between sharpness and generalization
item.description: Overall, we observe that sharpness does not correlate well with generalization but rather with some training parameters like the learning rate that can be positively or negatively correlated with generalization depending on the setup.

item.title: Predicting long-term collective animal behavior with deep learning
item.description: This work introduces a deep learning model for social interactions in the fish species Hemigrammus rhodostomus, and compares its results to experiments and to the results of a state-of-the-art analytical model.

item.title: EPISODE: Episodic Gradient Clipping with Periodic Resampled Corrections for Federated Learning with Heterogeneous Data
item.description: In this paper, we design EPISODE, the very first algorithm to solve FL problems with heterogeneous data in the nonconvex and relaxed smoothness setting.

item.title: One-Shot Federated Conformal Prediction
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a conformal prediction method to construct prediction sets in a oneshot federated learning setting.

item.title: Automatic Noise Filtering with Dynamic Sparse Training in Deep Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Tomorrow's robots will need to distinguish useful information from noise when performing different tasks.

item.title: Probabilistic Circuits That Know What They Don't Know
item.description: In contrast to neural networks, they are often assumed to be well-calibrated and robust to out-of-distribution (OOD) data.

item.title: Raising the Cost of Malicious AI-Powered Image Editing
item.description: We present an approach to mitigating the risks of malicious image editing posed by large diffusion models.

item.title: Simple Hardware-Efficient Long Convolutions for Sequence Modeling
item.description: We find that a key requirement to achieving high performance is keeping the convolution kernels smooth.

item.title: SLIM: Sparsified Late Interaction for Multi-Vector Retrieval with Inverted Indexes
item.description: Among them, ColBERT is probably the most established method which is based on the late interaction of contextualized token embeddings of pre-trained language models.

item.title: Comp2Comp: Open-Source Body Composition Assessment on Computed Tomography
item.description: Extracting quantitative body composition measures manually from CT scans is a cumbersome and time-consuming task.

item.title: VA-DepthNet: A Variational Approach to Single Image Depth Prediction
item.description: While state-of-the-art deep neural network methods for SIDP learn the scene depth from images in a supervised setting, they often overlook the invaluable invariances and priors in the rigid scene space, such as the regularity of the scene.

item.title: Reliability Assurance for Deep Neural Network Architectures Against Numerical Defects
item.description: To assure high reliability against numerical defects, in this paper, we propose the RANUM approach including novel techniques for three reliability assurance tasks: detection of potential numerical defects, confirmation of potential-defect feasibility, and suggestion of defect fixes.

item.title: Enhancing Multivariate Time Series Classifiers through Self-Attention and Relative Positioning Infusion
item.description: Time Series Classification (TSC) is an important and challenging task for many visual computing applications.

item.title: TIGER: Temporal Interaction Graph Embedding with Restarts
item.description: However, due to the entangled temporal and structural dependencies, existing methods have to process the sequence of events chronologically and consecutively to ensure node representations are up-to-date.

item.title: AbLit: A Resource for Analyzing and Generating Abridged Versions of English Literature
item.description: The dataset captures passage-level alignments between the original and abridged texts.

item.title: Large Scale Multi-Lingual Multi-Modal Summarization Dataset
item.description: Significant developments in techniques such as encoder-decoder models have enabled us to represent information comprising multiple modalities.

item.title: Distinguishability Calibration to In-Context Learning
item.description: When using prompt-based learning for text classification, the goal is to use a pre-trained language model (PLM) to predict a missing token in a pre-defined template given an input text, which can be mapped to a class label.

item.title: ELEA -- Build your own Evolutionary Algorithm in your Browser
item.description: We provide an open source framework to experiment with evolutionary algorithms which we call "Experimenting and Learning toolkit for Evolutionary Algorithms (ELEA)".

item.title: Stitchable Neural Networks
item.description: As each model family consists of pretrained models with diverse scales (e. g., DeiT-Ti/S/B), it naturally arises a fundamental question of how to effectively assemble these readily available models in a family for dynamic accuracy-efficiency trade-offs at runtime.

item.title: CholecTriplet2022: Show me a tool and tell me the triplet -- an endoscopic vision challenge for surgical action triplet detection
item.description: This paper presents the CholecTriplet2022 challenge, which extends surgical action triplet modeling from recognition to detection.

item.title: Online Arbitrary Shaped Clustering through Correlated Gaussian Functions
item.description: There is no convincing evidence that backpropagation is a biologically plausible mechanism, and further studies of alternative learning methods are needed.

item.title: Preconditioned Score-based Generative Models
item.description: Compared with the latest generative models (\eg, CLD-SGM, DDIM, and Analytic-DDIM), PDS can achieve the best sampling quality on CIFAR-10 at a FID score of 1. 99.

item.title: UniAdapter: Unified Parameter-Efficient Transfer Learning for Cross-modal Modeling
item.description: Particularly, on the MSRVTT retrieval task, UniAdapter achieves 49. 7% recall@1 with 2. 2% model parameters, outperforming the latest competitors by 2. 0%.

item.title: Implications of the Convergence of Language and Vision Model Geometries
item.description: Large-scale pretrained language models (LMs) are said to ``lack the ability to connect [their] utterances to the world'' (Bender and Koller, 2020).

item.title: Deep Anatomical Federated Network (Dafne): an open client/server framework for the continuous collaborative improvement of deep-learning-based medical image segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation is a crucial step to extract quantitative information from medical (and, specifically, radiological) images to aid the diagnostic process, clinical follow-up.

item.title: Why Can't Discourse Parsing Generalize? A Thorough Investigation of the Impact of Data Diversity
item.description: To our knowledge, this study is the first to fully evaluate cross-corpus RST parsing generalizability on complete trees, examine between-genre degradation within an RST corpus, and investigate the impact of genre diversity in training data composition.

item.title: Improving Recommendation Fairness via Data Augmentation
item.description: We augment imbalanced training data towards balanced data distribution to improve fairness.

item.title: Contour Context: Abstract Structural Distribution for 3D LiDAR Loop Detection and Metric Pose Estimation
item.description: This paper proposes \textit{Contour Context}, a simple, effective, and efficient topological loop closure detection pipeline with accurate 3-DoF metric pose estimation, targeting the urban utonomous driving scenario.

item.title: Can GPT-3 Perform Statutory Reasoning?
item.description: By also posing the same questions when the synthetic statutes are written in sentence form, we find that some of GPT-3's poor performance results from difficulty in parsing the typical structure of statutes, containing subsections and paragraphs.
